content.text:
[cron:8b380d56-7314-4ba9-b4c4-ea11d3e5ca6f PR Review Patrol (High Frequency)] PR patrol for bills-bot.

Repo: /home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/bills-bot/

⚠️ CRITICAL RULE: Only check PRs authored by Bill (BillChirico) or by Pip Build / sub-agents. Do NOT check, fix, or address PRs from anyone else (other contributors, bots like coderabbitai, dependabot[bot], renovate[bot]) unless Bill has explicitly told you to.

Do this each run:
1) List open PRs in BillChirico/bills-bot.
2) Filter to ONLY Bill's PRs and Pip Build's PRs. Skip everything else.
3) For eligible PRs, count unresolved review threads.
4) If no unresolved threads on eligible PRs: respond exactly `NO_REPLY`.
5) If unresolved threads exist:
   - Spawn ONE sub-agent PER PR (parallel), never batch PRs together.
   - Use agentId `build`, model `anthropic/claude-opus-4-6`, thinking `high`.
   - Include full unresolved thread details (thread id, file path, line, issue summary).
   - Instruct spawned agents to read and follow CODING.md, fix all review comments (including nitpicks unless nonsensical/breaking/redundant), run tests/coverage, resolve threads.
   - Instruct spawned agents NOT to post PR summary comments unless Bill explicitly asks.
   - Have spawned agents report completion summary back to parent agent.
   - After spawning, send Bill a concise Discord DM status update:
     - channel: discord
     - target: user:191633014441115648
     - accountId: pip-build
     - include PR numbers and unresolved thread counts.
6) If any spawned run fails/stalls, note it in DM and respawn once.

Keep updates concise and action-oriented.
Current time: Monday, February 16th, 2026 — 11:07 PM (America/New_York)

content.thinking:
**Initiating PR Review Patrol**

I'm currently focused on setting up a PR review patrol for the `bills-bot` repo. My main task now involves retrieving the open pull requests from the specified repository. I'm prioritizing filtering them to include only those authored by `BillChirico` or the Pip Build agents. Ultimately, I need to count them.

arguments.command:
cd /home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/bills-bot
# Get Bill's open PRs and their unresolved thread counts, paginated
gh pr list --state open --author BillChirico --json number,title,headRefName,author --jq '.[]' | while read -r pr; do
  PR_NUM=$(echo "$pr" | jq -r '.number')
  PR_TITLE=$(echo "$pr" | jq -r '.title')
  PR_BRANCH=$(echo "$pr" | jq -r '.headRefName')

  CURSOR=""
  TOTAL_UNRESOLVED=0
  THREADS_DATA="[]"
  
  while true; do
    if [ -z "$CURSOR" ]; then
      QUERY="{repository(owner:\"BillChirico\",name:\"bills-bot\"){pullRequest(number:$PR_NUM){reviewThreads(first:100){pageInfo{hasNextPage endCursor} nodes{id isResolved path line diffSide comments(first:1){nodes{body}}}}}}}"
    else
      QUERY="{repository(owner:\"BillChirico\",name:\"bills-bot\"){pullRequest(number:$PR_NUM){reviewThreads(first:100,after:\"$CURSOR\"){pageInfo{hasNextPage endCursor} nodes{id isResolved path line diffSide comments(first:1){nodes{body}}}}}}}"
    fi
    
    RESULT=$(gh api graphql -f query="$QUERY")
    
    # Extract unresolved nodes
    UNRESOLVED_NODES=$(echo "$RESULT" | jq -c '.data.repository.pullRequest.reviewThreads.nodes | map(select(.isResolved == false))')
    PAGE_UNRESOLVED_COUNT=$(echo "$UNRESOLVED_NODES" | jq 'length')
    TOTAL_UNRESOLVED=$((TOTAL_UNRESOLVED + PAGE_UNRESOLVED_COUNT))
    
    # Collect thread details for spawn task
    THREADS_DATA=$(echo "$THREADS_DATA" | jq --argjson new "$UNRESOLVED_NODES" '. + $new')
    
    HAS_NEXT=$(echo "$RESULT" | jq -r '.data.repository.pullRequest.reviewThreads.pageInfo.hasNextPage')
    if [ "$HAS_NEXT" = "true" ]; then
      CURSOR=$(echo "$RESULT" | jq -r '.data.repository.pullRequest.reviewThreads.pageInfo.endCursor')
    else
      break
    fi
  done
  
  if [ "$TOTAL_UNRESOLVED" -gt 0 ]; then
    echo "DATA:{\"number\":$PR_NUM,\"title\":\"$PR_TITLE\",\"branch\":\"$PR_BRANCH\",\"unresolvedCount\":$TOTAL_UNRESOLVED,\"threads\":$THREADS_DATA}"
  fi
done

cd /home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/bills-bot
gh pr list --state open --json number,author,title

**Analyzing the Rules**

I am now focused on the single open PR. I see it's from `AnExiledDev`, not `BillChirico` or the automated agent. The critical rule is clear: only Bill or the agent's PRs get a green light. My analysis suggests no further action is warranted; I need to respond accordingly.
